title: Britain's savings market has long been a mess, but now it is also an accident waiting to happen
text:
Caveat emptor - buyer beware. This has always been the first rule of investment, but it never ceases to amaze how often it is forgotten. We’ve just had another textbook case of it in the Neil Woodford debacle; there is seemingly almost no dog he didn’t invest in.

Bewitched by the cult of the star fund manager, investors likewise were only too eager to follow the Pied Piper of Hamelin on his greed fueled dance into the outer frontiers of high risk investment.
